humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, 8 out of 10 examined lymph nodes demonstrated metastases. Based on the new rules provided, N2 indicates metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has ten examined lymph nodes with metastases, as stated in the microscopic description section of the report. According to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system, N stage is determined by the number of lymph nodes with metastases. In this case, N2 corresponds to 'Metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes.' However, the report mentions 'Axillary 8/10' which can be interpreted as 8 out of 10 lymph nodes with metastases. Nonetheless, based on the information provided, the patient's N stage is N2.
